title: Preliminary Findings
text: How does participation in a virtual nature-based intervention prior to an exam affect nursing students’ perception of test-related anxiety, academic stress, self-reported resilience, academic performance, and their overall experience of the intervention?’

title: Preliminary Findings
text: How does participation in a virtual nature-based intervention prior to an exam affect nursing students’ perception of test-related anxiety, academic stress, self-reported resilience, academic performance, and their overall experience of the intervention?’

title: Preliminary Findings
text:
Hypotheses
Participation in a virtual nature-based intervention prior to an exam significantly:

H1: reduces nursing students’ perception of test-related anxiety,
H2: increases self-reported resilience
H3: improves academic performance
H4: positively influences their overall experience of the intervention.









Paired-Samples T-Test


All tests compares post-intervention scores to pre-intervention scores

title: Preliminary Findings
text:
Inferential Results
Results indicate that only H3 receives support as shown by a paired samples t-test, t(43) = 3.50, p = .001, d = .64, 95% CI[.59, 2.18].
Results for H1, H2, and H4, all have p-values above the alpha of .05 and their confidence intervals include 0 as an estimate.

title: Preliminary Findings
text:
Descriptive Statistics

H5: A negative correlation is expected between test anxiety and exam scores
H6: a positive correlation is anticipated between resilience and exam scores
